sn28.1:1.1: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn28.1:1.2: Then Venerable Sāriputta robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
sn28.1:1.3: He wandered for alms in Sāvatthī. After the meal, on his return from alms-round, he went to the Dark Forest,
sn28.1:1.4: plunged deep into it, and sat at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.
sn28.1:2.1: Then in the late afternoon, Sāriputta came out of retreat and went to Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn28.1:2.2: Venerable Ānanda saw him coming off in the distance,
sn28.1:2.4: “Reverend Sāriputta, your faculties are so very clear, and your complexion is pure and bright.
sn28.1:2.5: What meditation were you practicing today?”
sn28.1:3.1: “Reverend, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, I entered and remained in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
sn28.1:3.2: But it didn’t occur to me:
sn28.1:3.3: ‘I am entering the first absorption’ or ‘I have entered the first absorption’ or ‘I am emerging from the first absorption’.”
sn28.1:3.4: “That must be because Venerable Sāriputta has long ago totally eradicated ego, possessiveness, and the underlying tendency to conceit.
sn28.1:3.5: That’s why it didn’t occur to you:
sn28.1:3.6: ‘I am entering the first absorption’ or ‘I have entered the first absorption’ or ‘I am emerging from the first absorption’.”
